FROM SLACK
New Request from daivq
==========

Hi DevOps Team,
Could you please assist with installing updated software on `psmacmini14`, `psmacmini15`, and `psmacmini6`? The details are below.
1. Java Installation
Please install OpenJDK 17. For reference, the specific build I am currently using is:

```
openjdk 17.0.14 2025-01-21
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Homebrew (build 17.0.14+0)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Homebrew (build 17.0.14+0, mixed mode, sharing)
```

2. Android NDK Installation
Please install NDK version **27.0.12077973. This can be installed via the `sdkmanager` by following these steps:

  • Navigate to the command-line tools directory:

```
cd /Applications/Unity/Hub/Editor/2022.3.62f1/PlaybackEngines/AndroidPlayer/SDK/cmdline-tools/6.0/bin
```

  • Run the - sdkmanager- to install the NDK:

```
./sdkmanager "ndk;27.0.12077973"
```
Please let us know if you have any questions. Thank you!

—
Priority: Medium
—
Original Request Message: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C06SBLHLY22/p1753339668895579

. This can be installed via the `sdkmanager` by following these steps:

renderedFields.description:
Investigate the root cause on Jarvis of the 502 and 504 errors raised every day @ 8:00 AM HKT.

The actual cause has previously been identified to be the Loyalty Engine. We want to find out why the Brainium Solitaire backend is throwing the errors.

Possible causes

  • timeouts on waiting for LE(loyalty engine) responses
  • gateway errors during scale out

fields.summary: Investigate 5xx errors on Solitatire/Brainium BE

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: Investigate the root cause on Jarvis of the 502 and 504 errors raised every day @ 8:00 AM HKT.
The actual cause has previously been identified to be the Loyalty Engine. We want to find out why the Brainium Solitaire backend is throwing the errors.
timeouts on waiting for LE(loyalty engine) responses

renderedFields.description:
FROM SLACK
New Request from tommy.nguyen
==========

We're investigating potential performance issues with playlink-BI, specifically around high event volumes from Tetris Prime that may be causing system bottlenecks. Before making any architectural changes (like implementing EventHub), we need to understand our current baseline and identify real bottlenecks. Could you help us gather this data? We'd really appreciate your expertise in this area.

Could you help provide current traffic data for playlink-BI?

  • Average and peak RPS (requests per second)
  • Traffic patterns over the last 30 days
  • Any monitoring dashboards showing request volume from different games/clients
  • Specific data on Tetris Prime's event volume if available

We want to make evidence-based decisions about whether EventHub implementation is necessary, rather than proceeding based on assumptions.
This data will help guide our architectural decisions and ensure we're solving real problems, not imaginary ones. Thanks so much for your support!
cc minh (Minh Hoang) ervib (Ervi Bongso) veronica.medina (Vero Medina)

—
Priority: High
Due Date: 07/09/2025
—
Original Request Message: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C06SBLHLY22/p1751444499498159

fields.summary: Request for playlink-BI Traffic Data

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: We're investigating potential performance issues with playlink-BI, specifically around high event volumes from Tetris Prime that may be causing system bottlenecks. Before making any architectural changes (like implementing EventHub), we need to understand our current baseline and identify real bottlenecks. Could you help us gather this data? We'd really appreciate your expertise in this area.
Could you help provide current traffic data for playlink-BI?
Average and peak RPS (requests per second)
Traffic patterns over the last 30 days
Any monitoring dashboards showing request volume from different games/clients
Specific data on Tetris Prime's event volume if available
We want to make evidence-based decisions about whether EventHub implementation is necessary, rather than proceeding based on assumptions.
This data will help guide our architectural decisions and ensure we're solving real problems, not imaginary ones. Thanks so much for your support!
cc minh (Minh Hoang) ervib (Ervi Bongso) veronica.medina (Vero Medina)

Actually this request is misleading. The requested unity version is already installed on macbuilder03.

They want us to investigate why the build is failing.
https://github.com/playstudios/sweeps-slotstudio-client/actions/runs/15918785603/job/44901253993 

Run /Applications/Unity/Hub/Editor/6000.0.50f1/Unity.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity -quit -batchmode -nographics -silent-crashes -logFile -buildTarget WebGL -projectpath . -executeMethod Editor.BuildSystem.BuildSystemUICmd.BuildPlayer buildNumber=$GITHUB_RUN_NUMBER environment=trunk bundleLoadMethod=Remote
  /Applications/Unity/Hub/Editor/6000.0.50f1/Unity.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity -quit -batchmode -nographics -silent-crashes -logFile -buildTarget WebGL -projectpath . -executeMethod Editor.BuildSystem.BuildSystemUICmd.BuildPlayer buildNumber=$GITHUB_RUN_NUMBER environment=trunk bundleLoadMethod=Remote
  shell: /opt/local/bin/bash -e {0}
  env:
    GIT_HASH: 5365d0b5e5d3d946b00712128f2979fe744c4920
    WORKSPACE_DIR: build_webgl_sweeps
    PLATFORM: WebGL
    UNITY: /Applications/Unity/Hub/Editor/6000.0.50f1/Unity.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity
    UNITY_OPS: -quit -batchmode -nographics -silent-crashes -logFile
    BUILD_NUMBER: buildNumber=$GITHUB_RUN_NUMBER
    BUILD_ASSETBUNDLES: bundleLoadMethod=Remote
    EMSDK_PYTHON: /opt/local/bin/python2
[UnityConnectServicesConfig] Local config successfully read: "/Library/Application Support/Unity/config/services-config.json"
[UnityConnectServicesConfig] "licensingServiceBaseUrl" was overridden with "http://192.168.150.10:81"
[UnityConnectServicesConfig] "clientConnectTimeoutSec" was overridden with "60"
[UnityConnectServicesConfig] "clientHandshakeTimeoutSec" was overridden with "30"
[UnityConnectServicesConfig] Service configuration:
    "servicesConfigBaseUrl": "",
    "disableServicesWindow": false,
    "disableUserLogin": false,
    "entitlementCacheTimeoutInSeconds": 60,
    "clientConnectTimeoutSec": 60,
    "clientHandshakeTimeoutSec": 30,
    "clientResolveEntitlementsTimeoutSec": 30,
    "clientUpdateLicenseTimeoutSec": 30,
    "licensingServiceBaseUrl": "http://192.168.150.10:81",
    "enableProxyAutoconfig": "false"

Unable to open log file, exiting.
Error: Process completed with exit code 127.

After talking with Steven Chan these are the steps required to upgrade the Unity version

  • upgrade the gradle version: brew install gradle@8
  • install the new version of Unity (matching the MX one) 
    • $ /Applications/Unity\ Hub.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity\ Hub -- --headless install --version 6000.0.50f1 --changeset f1ef1dca8bff
$ /Applications/Unity\ Hub.app/Contents/MacOS/Unity\ Hub -- --headless install-modules --version 6000.0.50f1 --changeset f1ef1dca8bff -m ios android webgl --cm

Note

  • there will be 2 Unity versions on the build machine.
  • the dev team will need to upgrade the Unity project and build scripts for the latest Unity and to point to the new Unity installation

Build machine: macbuilder03

Build pipeline: https://github.com/playstudios/sweeps-slotstudio-client/actions/runs/15911426463

renderedFields.description:
pl-stage-kong-gateway is keep failing to connect to Redis in Stage, the errors is spammed frequently, result in increase of memory. Investigate and fix this issue.
Full logs

Findings:

  • This error is happened in the past, seem like Kong has never connected to Redis Stage.
  • The first error was related to DNS resolver because Kong Stage is running on Dev cluster in Dev Vnet
    failed to connect to redis: [cosocket] DNS resolution failed: dns server error: 3 name error. Tried: [\"(short)pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.redis.cache.windows.net:(na) - cache-hit/dereferencing CNAME\",\"(short)pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.privatelink.redis.cache.windows.net:(na) - cache-miss\",\"pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.privatelink.redis.cache.windows.net:33 → Fail DNS resolve log
    But this is fixed because I have temporary added this private link (which allow Dev to call to Redis in Stage), it help K8s to resolved Redis DNS name in Stage. Please removed and add this to terraform when finished this ticket
  • After the DNS issue is fixed, Kong still can’t connect to Redis, the logs is vague, but I suspect the issue could be related to authentication, please check the Vault secrets if they are correct.
    error in fetching counters for namespace bi-default-public: }}failed to connect to redis{{: closed, context: ngx.timer-> Fail authenication log

Discussion Thread:https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C04D0TEE5NF/p1750136114164039

fields.summary: pl-stage-kong-gateway failed to connect to Redis

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: pl-stage-kong-gateway is keep failing to connect to Redis in Stage, the errors is spammed frequently, result in increase of memory. Investigate and fix this issue.
This error is happened in the past, seem like Kong has never connected to Redis Stage.
The first error was related to DNS resolver because Kong Stage is running on Dev cluster in Dev Vnet

failed to connect to redis: [cosocket] DNS resolution failed: dns server error: 3 name error. Tried: [\"(short)pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.redis.cache.windows.net:(na) - cache-hit/dereferencing CNAME\",\"(short)pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.privatelink.redis.cache.windows.net:(na) - cache-miss\",\"pl-stage-scus-cache-kong.privatelink.redis.cache.windows.net:33
But this is fixed because I have temporary added this
(which allow Dev to call to Redis in Stage), it help K8s to resolved Redis DNS name in Stage. Please removed and add this to terraform when finished this ticket
After the DNS issue is fixed, Kong still can’t connect to Redis, the logs is vague, but I suspect the issue could be related to authentication, please check the Vault secrets if they are correct.
error in fetching counters for namespace bi-default-public:

renderedFields.description:
FROM SLACK
New Request from chuongnv
==========

The issue happen on the Production
API: `https://backend.thewinzone.com/api/slotstudio/game/webhooks/deposit`
Method:` Post`
Request Body:

```
{
"CreditsWon": 0,
"JackpotCreditsWon": 0,
"CreditsWagered": 100,
"PlayerId": "QFE5WQ",
"BIData":

{ "BetIndex": 4, "MaxBetIndex": 20, "BetValue": 100, "IsPaidSpin": true }

,
"PaidSpinRoundId": "TI002B4vkNXz3oNlWgkVenuQ==",
"BuyABonusAmount": 0,
"UnitTransactionIsClosed": true,
"CreditWinnings": []
}
```

Response: Http 403

```
<body>
<div id='content'>
<div id='message'>
<h2>The request is blocked.</h2>
</div>
<div id='errorref'>
<span>20250616T014303Z-1787df57b7dmxzz4hC1SGNruus0000000f50000000006z9r </span>
</div>
</div>
</body>
```

*It seems that Sweeps WAF is blocking requests that contain content like *'`TI002B4vkNXz3oNlWgkVenuQ==`'.

Could you please help us check to see if we have a WAF rule that does like that !

thank you!!

—
Priority: Very High
Due Date: 06/16/2025
—
Original Request Message: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C06SBLHLY22/p1750038814722509

fields.summary: the Sweeps backend WAF (Web Application Firewall) policy blocking deposit requests from the Slotstudio backend

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: The issue happen on the Production
*It seems that Sweeps WAF is blocking requests that contain content like *'`TI002B4vkNXz3oNlWgkVenuQ==`'.
Could you please help us check to see if we have a WAF rule that does like that !

renderedFields.description:
we should have a look at this alert. this may be caused by sweeps 401 responses by the application itself. last we checked i believe the devs said these are 'expected'.
if that is the case we will need to exclude sweeps from the alert to avoid random calls when this happens on Prod

Slack: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C075BT67GMR/p1749705466188979

Alerting Rule

                  - alert: JwtAuthRequestFailures
                    expr: |
                      sum(rate(kong_http_requests_total{route!~"kong.*",namespace="kong", code="401"} [1m]))
                      / sum(rate(kong_http_requests_total{route!~"kong.*",namespace="kong"} [1m])) * 100
                      > 20
                    for: 5m
                    labels:
                      severity: warning
                    annotations:
                      summary: "More than 20% of calls to Kong Public APIs are failing JWT authentication in the last 5 minutes"
                      description: |
                        {{ $value }}% of the calls to the public api gateway have failed JWT authentication.
                        There might be an issue with how Kong is configured to authenticate JWTs or how the Backend
                        generates them.

fields.summary: Investigate JWT auth failure alert on jarvis QA & Staging

issuetype.name: Task

content.text: we should have a look at this alert. this may be caused by sweeps 401 responses by the application itself. last we checked i believe the devs said these are 'expected'.
if that is the case we will need to exclude sweeps from the alert to avoid random calls when this happens on Prod

- alert: JwtAuthRequestFailures
                    expr: |
                      sum(rate(kong_http_requests_total{route!~"kong.*",namespace="kong", code="401"} [1m]))
                      / sum(rate(kong_http_requests_total{route!~"kong.*",namespace="kong"} [1m])) * 100
                      > 20
                    for: 5m
                    labels:
                      severity: warning
                    annotations:
                      summary: "More than 20% of calls to Kong Public APIs are failing JWT authentication in the last 5 minutes"
                      description: |
                        {{ $value }}% of the calls to the public api gateway have failed JWT authentication.
                        There might be an issue with how Kong is configured to authenticate JWTs or how the Backend
                        generates them.

renderedFields.description:
This error may be caused by the fact that our github action that runs the KV validation does not handle the Review environment since this is not one of the typical environments we manage.

A workaround may be necessary OR adding Review as a supported environment in the action.

This is blocking the dev team from merging appsettings changes on the Review environment.
A solution must be proposed before going ahead with the implementation.

FROM SLACK
New Request from tantd1
==========

Hello
Currently, when updating the app settings for the Review environment, I encountered a strange error.

Could you please help me check it?

https://github.com/playstudios/jarvis-appsettings/actions/runs/15487530429/job/43605471473?pr=696

—

fields.summary: Update appsetting error in Review environment

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: This error may be caused by the fact that our github action that runs the KV validation does not handle the Review environment since this is not one of the typical environments we manage.
A workaround may be necessary OR adding Review as a supported environment in the action.
This is blocking the dev team from merging appsettings changes on the Review environment.
A solution must be proposed before going ahead with the implementation.
Currently, when updating the app settings for the Review environment, I encountered a strange error.
Could you please help me check it?

We need to migrate ADO pipeline playlink-tay to GitHub:

  • All steps are from common pipeline templates repo. This ticket https://playstudios.atlassian.net/browse/DO-3307 should already create the repo and migrate most common ADO templates to GitHub Actions shared workflows/composite actions. Let’s refer to this.
  • The pipeline might have extra steps or fewer steps comparing to the shared workflows mentioned above, so we might need to update the shared workflow or create a separate workflow for this pipeline.

renderedFields.description:
MX team is evaluating the possibility of using HTTP/2 calls from client to various systems.

  • Investigate the feasibility of switching to HTTP/2
  • document what configurations are required to enable support for HTTP/2

hi guys, I'd like to know if it possible to support HTTP/2 when communicating between client and any server it communicates to. I see client calls MX backend (mvmx.playstudios.com), akamaized (mvmx-assets.akamaized.net), AWS Firehose and Kinesis (firehose.us-west-2.amazonaws.com and kinesis.us-east-1.amazonaws.com) over http/1.1, what is the possibility of supporting http/2 on those server?
FYI @Steven Chan @Charles

Slack: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C08RS54GWU9/p1749023166070749

References

  • https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/fundamentals/servers/kestrel/http2?view=aspnetcore-9.0
  • https://support.konghq.com/support/s/article/Does-Kong-support-http2-protocol

fields.summary: Investigate support for HTTP/2 on Jarvis

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: MX team is evaluating the possibility of using HTTP/2 calls from client to various systems.
Investigate the feasibility of switching to HTTP/2
document what configurations are required to enable support for HTTP/2
hi guys, I'd like to know if it possible to support HTTP/2 when communicating between client and any server it communicates to. I see client calls MX backend (
) over http/1.1, what is the possibility of supporting http/2 on those server?

renderedFields.description:
FROM SLACK
New Request from ray.le
==========

hi george.stoica (Georgian Stoica) davide.benvegnu (Davide Benvegnu) over the weekend, we had several periods of transient network errors (SocketException) that lasted for a short moment, causing about 10 PagerDuty alerts over 2d, below is one example
Kong gateway CPU went down a bit exactly at that moment

Alita/redis was also normal at this time
MX encountered about 1.3k connection errors across several features that needs to call k8s (leaderboard, albums, ava)

over the day 17th May, total of *6k *failed connections caused exceptions.

MVMX CPU/memory stayed the same in those periods, connection count spiked due to connection failures.

could you help to look on your side, if anything happened at that moment? Like a maintenance window, an overload of something, and how could we prevent this from happening in the future?

cc charles (Charles Cheng)
PEV ticket (https://psasia.atlassian.net/browse/PEV-4132?linkSource=email)
current Slack discussion to continue: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C075989MB7E/p1747622935652779

—
Priority: High
Due Date: 05/26/2025
—
Original Request Message: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C06SBLHLY22/p1747625611302879

fields.summary: Transient network errors in over the weekend

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

content.text: hi george.stoica (Georgian Stoica) davide.benvegnu (Davide Benvegnu)  over the weekend, we had several periods of transient network errors (SocketException) that lasted for a short moment, causing about 10 PagerDuty alerts over 2d, below is one example
Kong gateway CPU went down a bit exactly at that moment
Alita/redis was also normal at this time
MX encountered about 1.3k connection errors across several features that needs to call k8s (leaderboard, albums, ava)
over the day 17th May, total of *6k *failed connections caused exceptions.
MVMX CPU/memory stayed the same in those periods, connection count spiked due to connection failures.
could you help to look on your side, if anything happened at that moment? Like a maintenance window, an overload of something, and how could we prevent this from happening in the future?

renderedFields.description:
FROM SLACK
New Request from tommy.nguyen
==========

Hi Team,

I'm encountering an issue when sending POST requests to the API endpoint:
https://api.playlnkdev.io/bi/api/PlaylinkThirdPartyBI/EventRouter

When the request body exceeds 30KB, I receive the following error:
"Read-only file system: '/tmp/'" (I've attached the full exception details below for reference)

Could you please let me know:
1. Is there a specific policy or limitation regarding request body size for this API?
2. If such a limitation exists, what are the recommended workarounds?
3. If no formal policy exists, would it be possible to increase the maximum allowed request size?

Thank you for your assistance.

—
Priority: High
Due Date: 05/08/2025
—
Original Request Message: https://playstudios.slack.com/archives/C06SBLHLY22/p1746678945162219

renderedFields.description:
Task 1 of 2

We need to create a new FULL environment for Sweeps, in QA.

This includes:

  • ArgoCD deployment
  • AppSettings
  • CI/CD (Actions? and Jenkins)
  • Infrastructure

“Full environment” means that we need all the services (Frontend, Backend, paysafe webhooks, etc)

url should be *.review.sweeps.jarvisqa.net

Original Request from matthew
==========

We would like to create 2 new environments for playSweeps

  • Review: A QA like environment that is meant to be stable and available for stakeholder review of new features without needing to have QA blocked.
  • UnlockedProd: An Copy of PROD without KYC, Geofencing, and Redemptions - used to send to 3rd parties for testing in blocked territories, and for internal US Staff to engage with the product.

—

Due Date: 05/19/2025
